title: Dreamscape

by doobler

summary: tony: steve what are you doing — steve, putting a bow on tony’s head: getting myself a birthday present
question: tony: steve what are you doing — steve, putting a bow on tony’s head: getting myself a birthday present
answer:
Tony: *gestures to the bow he’d put on his crotch* But I already got you a present?

Steve: *removes that bow and also puts it on Tony’s head*

Tony: you fucking nerd I love you

blog.name: sineadhdz
blog.title: Damn it, Jim. I'm a fangirl, not a Doctor!

summary:
[In the Sanctum Sanctorum]
Peter: So, you are my dad's new boyfriend. 
Stephen: No, I'm-m
Peter: Well, let me tell you...
body:
[In the Sanctum Sanctorum]

Peter: So, you are my dad’s new boyfriend.

Stephen: No, I’m-m

Peter: Well, let me tell you something: you hurt him, I hurt you.

Stephen: Okay, but I’m not-

Peter: I like you, Doctor Wizard. I really do. But you’d better make my dad happy because if I see his eyes losing their brightness because of you, you’ll regret it. Am I clear?

Stephen: Yes. But you have to listen to me. I’m not your dad’s boyfriend.

Peter: Are you not?

Stephen: I’m not. We are just friends-

Peter: With benefits? Are you messing with me? Are you messing with HIM? Because I’ll kill you if you are.

Stephen: …

Peter: …

Stephen: You know what? Yes, I’m Tony’s boyfriend. I love him so much I’d kill myself if I hurt him.

Peter: I knew it! I knew you were together, and I asked Mr. Stark but he refused to answer. Oh, I can’t believe it was so easy to make you accept it.

Stephen: …

Peter: I gotta go. Don’t misunderstand me, I love being here and all, but the look in your eyes is scaring the hell out of me. See you, Doctor Wizard!

summary: What if Steve’s birthday isn’t 4th July?
title: What if Steve’s birthday isn’t 4th July?
body:
What if it’s something totally random like 12th October or 27th August and no one knows because July 4th birthday was created by the army commanders who made Captain America for patriotism and that sort of shit?

But then what if when Bucky comes back he knows - because of course he does, it’s Bucky - and then he tells Tony because he thinks Steve would have by now, but Tony didn’t know.

Tony is shocked that no one ever found out or that Steve never told him, but he doesn’t say anything about knowing until Steve’s actual birthday comes around. Steve comes home on 8th January to a candlelit dinner and a small table of neatly wrapped presents and he and Tony have a quiet, small birthday with just the two of them on Steve’s actual birthday, just like Steve had wanted since his mom died. 

No flags, no fireworks, no apple pie. No parties or drinking games or meet and greets. 

Just Tony and Steve and love, soft and serene.

blog.name: loki-tony-peter-rhodey-nebula
blog.title: Please Don't Go, Tony.
blog.description: profile pic art: @spidey-art Tony, Trans(ftm), Demiromantic, Pansexual. I love ScienceBoyfriends, Ironstrange, FrostIronStrange, Supreme Family, and just IronDad in general. It doesn't even have to be SpideySon. I just love the idea of Tony being a dad.

body:
The Difference in Tony’s Parenting

Peter: “Ow.”

Tony: “Are you okay?! Pete!? Are you alright!? What’s wrong!? What happened?”

Peter: “Ugh. I’m fiiiiinnnneeee.”

~~~vs~~~

Harley: “Ow.”

Tony: “Walk it off, ya little bitch.”

Harley: “Thanks, dad.”

summary: 004/100 AUs | Parent Teacher Conference | Stony + neighbor kid Peter | PG
title: 004/100 AUs | Parent Teacher Conference | Stony + neighbor kid Peter | PG
body:
The premise of the 100 AUs is incredibly simple.  I love this gif, and I hate Civil War, so I’m just going to keep rewriting the scene as long as I can.  The goal is 100 but lets see how far I make it.

“Wait,” Tony said.  They were six steps from the door, looking exactly like someone might assume two fathers would look when dragged away from the very important business of their day.  (The fact that they were not, in fact, Peter’s fathers wasn’t nearly as important as the pretense.)  “Let’s go over the plan again.”

“I know the plan,” Steve said.

The trouble with Steve wasn’t that he didn’t always know the plan.  He always knew the plan.  The trouble was that knowing the plan never seemed to be an important enough factor in following the plan.  “We’re going to go in there, shake hands, and be very disappointed in our son.”

“I thought he was our nephew,” Steve said.

“Our son like nephew,” Tony said.  “That’s all we’re going to do, Steve.  We’re not going to argue with the teacher.  We’re not going to tell them that they are wrong.  We are not going to demand they reduce the length of the suspension or that they remove the entire incident from his record.  We’re just going to be disappointed.”

There was no chance that Steve was going to make it through a meeting with this math teacher and maintain a level of acceptable disappointment.  It wasn’t that he agreed with what Peter had done; he didn’t even agree with being a stand-in for Peter’s real parent.  No, Steve’s problem was that he had never met an authority figure that he wanted to agree with.  He never saw a fight that wasn’t worth fighting.  “If you didn’t think I could do this, why did you ask me come?”

Tony had not asked.  Tony had advised against the inclusion of his well-intentioned boyfriend, but Peter had his heart set on having both of them.  Tony was Italian (or close enough) and that meant he could pass as someone related to Aunt May, and Steve was.  Well, Steve was–  

Intimidating.

“Disappointed,” Tony repeated.  “We’re going to be very disappointed in our son-nephew.”

Steve sighed at him.  “Fine.”

“If you feel like you might want to start objecting, just look at me.”

Peter leaned back out of the classroom door, looking as sharp as a sixteen year old could possibly look, wearing a tie that Tony had fixed in the parking lot and a suit that he probably had outgrown the year before.  “Coming Uncle Tony?”

“We’ll be right there, kid,” Tony said.  “Disappointed?”

“The most disappointed peripherally related not blood relative that Peter has,” Steve said like a promise.  

[Other AUs here]

“Our son like nephew,” Tony said.  “That’s all we’re going to do, Steve.  We’re not going to argue with the teacher.  We’re not going to tell them that they are wrong.  We are not going to demand they reduce the length of the suspension or that they remove the entire incident from his record.  We’re just going to be disappointed.”

There was no chance that Steve was going to make it through a meeting with this math teacher and maintain a level of acceptable disappointment.  It wasn’t that he agreed with what Peter had done; he didn’t even agree with being a stand-in for Peter’s real parent.  No, Steve’s problem was that he had never met an authority figure that he wanted to agree with.  He never saw a fight that wasn’t worth fighting.  “If you didn’t think I could do this, why did you ask me come?”

Tony had not asked.  Tony had advised against the inclusion of his well-intentioned boyfriend, but Peter had his heart set on having both of them.  Tony was Italian (or close enough) and that meant he could pass as someone related to Aunt May, and Steve was.  Well, Steve was–  

Intimidating.

“Disappointed,” Tony repeated.  “We’re going to be very disappointed in our son-nephew.”

Steve sighed at him.  “Fine.”

“If you feel like you might want to start objecting, just look at me.”

Peter leaned back out of the classroom door, looking as sharp as a sixteen year old could possibly look, wearing a tie that Tony had fixed in the parking lot and a suit that he probably had outgrown the year before.  “Coming Uncle Tony?”

“We’ll be right there, kid,” Tony said.  “Disappointed?”

“The most disappointed peripherally related not blood relative that Peter has,” Steve said like a promise.  

[Other AUs here]

body:
Why??

Why have the powers that be in the MCU not taken the time to celebrate today the way it should be. Like, I’m not asking much, but a little short video of cap on his 100th birthday. I mean….even though Tony is in another planet, I doubt very seriously that he would have let this day pass without at the very least dragging cap about his age.

summary: Peter Quill: So, who is the current president of the United States? Steve Rogers & Tony Stark: Donald Trump. Peter Quill: Are...
body:
Peter Quill: So, who is the current president of the United States?

Steve Rogers & Tony Stark: Donald Trump.

Peter Quill: Are you joking, right? How can a tv celebrity become a president?

Peter Parker: Have you watched Back to the Future?

Peter Quill: Yes, why?

Peter Parker: Remember the scene about Ronald Reagan?

Peter Quill:… We are doomed.

summary: Tony: Okay, the place is all clean. The wine is in the fridge. What is this pitcher of gray water? Steve: I read an article that...
body:
Tony: Okay, the place is all clean. The wine is in the fridge. What is this pitcher of gray water?
Steve: I read an article that said when you wash vegetables, all the nutrients leech into the water and then you can drink it. They call it a super water.
Tony: Oh. Well, that’s neat. I am gonna just hide it right over here.
